text: My husband and I love each other immensely (married 12 years), but he rarely wears his ring because it sometimes causes an allergic reaction on his finger and he’s more comfortable without it, and I rotate through wearing the rings he bought me, vintage rings I bought myself in a different metal, my mother’s rings, my grandmother’s rings, and rings from my mom’s first marriage. He doesn’t mind, so I wear whatever sparks my interest on any given day. He just recently talked about getting a new ring with a meaningful design and that sounds nice - I want him to be happy, so whatever he wants to do ring-wise is fine.
YES. I get panicky just thinking about it. I’m fine with shots and blood on its own, but I nearly faint every time I have to have my blood drawn.

The idea of demons - like intangible beings that I can’t hurt but they can hurt me. That creeps me right the heck out. Also irrationally afraid of medium-large spiders. I can deal with the little ones, but the big ones give me anxiety and it takes a long time for me to calm down.

Oh no! You are so lovely and beautiful with your gorgeous bone structure and coloring, and the piercings and lipstick enhance that. I’m super envious of you! I know it’s hard to see yourself objectively, but you really are so pretty!
